history.content:
It depends on what you want to do. If you know you want to go into theory/AI (17x and 18x series courses), you should take CS 70. For pretty much anything else, and especially if you want to take a lot of classes in the 16x series, 61C is needed.

Unfortunately, I can only really suggest upper divs for you to take depending on whether you like theory/AI or whether you want to go into something more systems related. I think given that you've taken up to CS 61B, I think CS 160 and CS184 (assuming you've done lin alg) are the only upper divs whose prerequisites you've met. But fyi, I had a miserable time in CS 160 this semester. And I have no clue what 184 is like.

It depends on what you want to do. If you know you want to go into theory/AI (17x and 18x series courses), you should take CS 188. For pretty much anything else, and especially if you want to take a lot of classes in the 16x series, 61C is needed.

Unfortunately, I can only really suggest upper divs for you to take depending on whether you like theory/AI or whether you want to go into something more systems related. I think given that you've taken up to CS 61B, I think CS 160 and CS184 (assuming you've done lin alg) are the only upper divs whose prerequisites you've met. But fyi, I had a miserable time in CS 160 this semester. And I have no clue what 184 is like.

It depends on what you want to do. If you know you want to go into theory/AI (17x and 18x series courses), you should take CS 188. For pretty much anything else, and especially if you want to take a lot of classes in the 16x series, 61C is needed.

Unfortunately, I can only really suggest upper divs for you to take depending on whether you like theory/AI or whether you want to go into something more systems related. I think given that you've taken up to CS 61B, I think CS 160 is the only upper div whose prerequisites you've met. But fyi, I had a miserable time in that class this semester. Would not recommend.

children.subject: Systems would be databases, operating systems, high performance computing, etc. CS 70 sounds like a good choice for you then.

I still haven't taken Math 54 so I guess CS 184 would be out of the question. However I'm definitely interested in going into AI, but I'm not entirely sure what something more systems related would entail?
I've heard it's recommended to take 188 and 170 together. Would you still recommend taking 188 without 170?
You'll be perfectly fine taking 188 and 70 concurrently. 170 and 188 don't depend on each other so you can take them in either order.

You can take 188 with only 61B knowledge. You can watch the probability lectures of 188 to check out the topics you need to self study. It's very basic probability topics from cs70 that's used in 188 that you should be able to learn on your own over the summer.

history.content: For a visual, you can check out HKN's course guide. Hover over the class and it will show you what you can take next. I know their EE map is not as up-to-date, but hopefully the CS map is.

So due to unforeseen circumstances, I'm barely able to register for classes now. I'm trying to decide whether I should take 70 or 61C next semester. Which would let me take more upperdivs the following semester? I don't want to take both since I'd prefer to not be miserable lol. Also does anyone have any suggestions for upperdivs to take after 61B?
history.subject: CS 70 vs CS 61C for upperdivs
